4 Fokus Kerja Menkes Terawan, dari Harga Obat hingga Defisit BPJS
05 Nov 2019, 10:30 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Kesehatan Terawan Agus Putranto menyampaikan empat fokus kerjanya dalam rapat dengar pendapat di Komisi IX Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat atau DPR, Selasa, 5 November 2019. Fokus kerja itu sesuai dengan tugas dari Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi.
"Visi dan misi presiden yang diberikan kepada kami ada empat hal penting. Pertama adalah penanganan stunting," ujar Terawan di kompleks Parlemen, Senayan, Jakarta hari ini.
Menurut data Kementerian Kesehatan, persentase stunting pada 2019 tercatat sebesar 27,67 persen. Angka ini turun 3,1 persen ketimbang 2018 yang mencapai 30,8 persen. Pada tahun mendatang, Kemenkes menargetkan stunting di Indonesia turun hingga di bawah 20 persen atau sesuai standar World Health Organization alias WHO.
Fokus Terawan selanjutnya adalah mengoptimalkan jaminan kesehatan nasional atau JKN, dan membantu masalah defisit yang ditanggung Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Sosial atau BPJS Kesehatan. Menurut hitungan pemerintah, defisit yang menjadi beban BPJS Kesehatan hingga akhir 2019 nanti diprediksi menyentuh Rp 32 triliun. "Ketiga adalah tingginya harga obat," tutur dia.

4 Focus of the Work on Health Minister Terawan, from Drug Prices to BPJS Deficits
05 Nov 2019, 10:30 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Health Terawan Agus Putranto delivered his four focus of work in a hearing at Commission IX of the House of Representatives or the House of Representatives, Tuesday, November 5, 2019. The focus of the work was in accordance with the duties of President Joko Widodo or Jokowi.
"The vision and mission of the president given to us are four important things. The first is handling stunting," Terawan said in the Parliament complex, Senayan, Jakarta today.
According to Ministry of Health data, the percentage of stunting in 2019 was recorded at 27.67 percent. This figure is down 3.1 percent compared to 2018 which reached 30.8 percent. In the coming year, the Ministry of Health targets stunting in Indonesia to fall below 20 percent or according to World Health Organization standards, aka WHO.
Terawan's next focus is to optimize national health insurance or JKN, and help with deficit problems borne by the Social Security Organizing Agency or BPJS Health. According to the government's calculations, the deficit that is a burden on BPJS Health until the end of 2019 is predicted to reach Rp 32 trillion. "Third is the high price of drugs," he said.
